{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3668564,"name":"ScottRandallWay","username":"ScottRandallWay","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/73ab20/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-06-29T16:55:40.387Z","cooked":"

I can successfully initialize, set, and retrieve values from the Preferences programmatically (Preferences (WPILib API 2025.3.2)). If I change a preference value on the shuffleboard (edit the value and click off the preferences widget), that value does not update in our program unless I redeploy the code. Is there something I need to do to refresh the preferences or persist the change?

I initialize the values when the robot container is created like this:

if (!Preferences.containsKey(ALGAE_MOTOR_SPEED)) {
Preferences.initDouble(ALGAE_MOTOR_SPEED, ALGAE_MOTOR_DEFAULT);
}

and I just read from the preferences in my commands where needed like this:

return Preferences.getDouble(ALGAE_MOTOR_SPEED, ALGAE_MOTOR_DEFAULT);
